{{Multiple issues |advert = September 2011 |unreferenced = September 2011 |notability = September 2011 }} {{Infobox software | name = GNU Paint | logo = | screenshot = [[Image:Gpaint-0.3.3-ubuntu.png|GNU Paint v0.3.3 running on [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]]|300px|300px]] | caption = GNU Paint v0.3.3 | collapsible = | author = | developer = Andy Tai | released = | latest release version = 0.3.3 | latest release date = {{start date and age|2007|09|10}}ftp://alpha.gnu.org/gnu/gpaint/ | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | frequently updated = No | programming language = [[C (programming language)|C]] | operating system = [[Linux]] | platform = | size = | language = English | status = | genre = [[Raster graphics editor]] | license = [[GNU General Public License]] | website = http://www.gnu.org/software/gpaint/ }} '''GNU Paint''', otherwise known as '''gpaint''', is a [[free and open source]] [[raster graphics editor]] that is similar to [[Paint (software)|Microsoft Paint]].http://www.gnu.org/software/gpaint/ It is [[free software]] licensed under the terms of [[GNU General Public License]] version 3 and is part of the [[GNU Project]].http://www.gnu.org/software/gpaint/# ==Features== Features of '''gpaint''' include: * Drawing tools such as ovals, freehand, polygon and text, with fill or shadow for polygons and closed freehand shapes. * Cut and paste by selecting irregular regions or polygons. * Preliminary print support using gnome-print. * Modern, ease-to-use user interface with tool and color palettes. * Multiple-image editing in a single instance of the program. * All the image processing features present in xpaint. * No facility to crop images ==Release history== {{Empty section|date=May 2010}} ==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} * [[Paint (software)]] * [[GIMP]] ==References== {{Reflist}}
